section.para: The Bill Payment function allows payment requests to be made to the bank for bills from registered Payees.

section.title: Bill Payment - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Bill Payment function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Bill Payment.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, there may be a link to the Bill Payment function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Bill Payment - Options
section.para: The Bill Payment function allows access to the Bill Payment module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bill Payment page, a number of options are provided for Bill Payment.
The following options are available for Bill Payment.

listitem.para: Create a new Bill Payment request.
Select from a list of service payees to generate a new Bill Payment request.
Review, complete and submit Bill Payment records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit Bill Payment records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Bill Payment - New Payment
section.para: When the New option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bill Payment page, it allows for the payment requests to be made for new bills that have been received from registered payees. This option will display a list of all outstanding bills that have been loaded into the system.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Bank, Payee Name or Category fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of system are the following:

Field
Description
Bank
The name of the bank holding the bill.
Payee Name
The name of the account that raised the bill.
Local Payee Name
The name of the account that raised the bill, in the local language.
Category
The type of bill.
Payee Description
A description of the goods or services provided by the Payee.
To select a bill for payment, click on the bill entry in the table of bills. When a bill is selected the system will request details regarding the Entity and account that is to pay the bill.
The details required are:

Field
Type
Description
Entity
The name of the Entity associated with the bill when it was loaded into the system.
Debit Account
Enter the account number that payment is to be made from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Recurring Payment
Place a tick in this box if the payment is to be a regularly occurring transfer.
When all fields have been completed, click the Ok button to specify the other remittance details.
The following sections describe the details required.

section.title: Bill Payment - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bill Payment page, it allows a Bill Payment request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Bill Payment - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bill Payment page, it allows a Bill Payment requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by and authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Bill Payment requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
